result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J. Neveaux

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  Mosinee Elementary School or staff, unless emergency with an escort.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 3:04 pm. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. Defendant appears pro se. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

COURT QUASHES WARRANTS. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): Mosinee Elementary School or staff, unless emergency with an escort. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.


>>FUTURE DATES: 
PTC: 1/17 at 1:15 pm.

Adj: 3:05 pm.
Re: Copy of Summons and Criminal Complaint mailed to defendant
